p: The read length distribution of the virus-specific small RNA reads ( Fig 2A) revealed two peaks at 23 and 26 nt, both of which fall within the 22â€“27 nt range for svRNA described in Perez et al. 2010 [ 5]. In contrast to the influenza-derived small RNA reads, the length distribution of mouse-derived small RNA reads from mock-infected mice revealed only a single peak at 22 nt ( Fig 2B), indicating that the overall profiles of influenza and mouse small RNA species are distinct. The mouse-derived small RNA peak that we identified at 22 nt is consistent with the original analysis performed on these hosts (see S1 Fig of Peng et al. 2011) [ 10].
